paper_abstract: This paper describes a process by which anthropologists, computer scientists, and social welfare case managers collaborated to build a stochastic model of welfare advising in Kentucky. In the process of collaboration, the research team rethought the Bayesian network model of Markov decision processes and designed a new knowledge elicitation format. We expect that this model will have wide applicability in other domains. (C) 2008 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Planning for success: The interdisciplinary approach to building Bayesian models
